articles.title: About
articles.description: NASA-Openscapes answers a NASA call to support NASA scientific researchers using data from the DAACs as they migrate workflows to the cloud.
articles.contents:
Openscapes
Openscapes champions open, inclusive practices in environmental and Earth science to help uncover data-intensive solutions faster. We do this through mentorship, coaching, training, and community organizing, leveraging existing resources from open communities along with our own.
Our flywheel shows our approach to engaging, empowering, and amplifying research communities in open data science. The flywheel is a concept by Jim Collins.
Openscapes flywheel shows 6 points around a hexagon: Develop, Invest, Attract, Deliver, Transform, InspireThe NASA-Openscapes project
The overarching vision is to support scientific researchers using NASA data as they migrate their workflows to the cloud. We are doing this working with NASA Distributed Active Archive Centers (DAACs) over three years by:
Developing a cross-DAAC Mentor community that supports growth into confident cloud data instructors, and create, curate and use shared resources and have a tutorial review process
Empowering science teams to experiment migrating their download-intensive data analysis workflows to the cloud through a partnership with Carpentries and 2i2c
Scaling the Openscapes Champions science cohorts with DAAC Mentors to support and amplify as many open science leaders as possible, transforming their workflows towards open, kinder science and the cloud
Timeline
This is the timeline for Year 1, which we will repeat in Years 2 and 3 as Mentors increasingly lead science cohorts at their own DAACs.
Gantt Chart for Year 1, January to December with 3 task headers: Engage DAAC Mentor Teams, Empower Science Teams, Amplify LeadersSlides

articles.title: Events
articles.contents:
May 17-18, 2021. Carpentries Workshop: Intro to Linux/Shell, Python, Git
This workshop is open to NASA Earth science data users, hosted by Openscapes, NASA, and the NASA Atmospheric Science Data Center (ASDC) DAAC.
For more information and to register: https://virdi.github.io/2021-05-17-openscapes-online/

March-June 2021. Openscapes Champions Mentors: DAAC Cohort
We are supporting and strengthening the community of DAAC folks that are already creating cloud learning resources. Through Openscapes mentorship, Carpentries instructor training, and 2i2c cloud services, these DAAC mentors will work together to create learning resources for their teams and communities.

articles.title: Mentors
articles.description: A cross-DAAC mentor community creating & teaching resources to help researchers migrate workflows to the cloud
articles.contents:
Our immediate activities with the Mentors (Mar-Jun 2021) are:
Build a DAAC community of practice through our biweekly Openscapes Cohort Calls, Carpentries Intro Python/Git Workshop and Carpentries Instructor Training
Develop participating teams as Mentors and help them practice teaching in a style to prepare them for the Openscapes Champions cohort (Aug-Nov) and AGU (Dec)
Support Mentors towards establishing a common set of tutorials that they can then build off their DAAC-specific and science examples

Openscapes Mentors Cohort Calls Summaries
1. March 18 2021: We started working towards a common understanding of how open science leads to transformational, better science in less time and develop our plan as a Cohort
Slide Decks:
Empowering Transformational Science - Chelle Gentemann
Better science in less time & Openscapes mindset - Julie Lowndes

2. April 1, 2021: We heard about each other’s work more and start discussing creating cloud tutorials and thinking about next steps
Resources:
Pathways Template

3. April 15, 2021: We discussed how the group would like to work together to create teaching materials, and discussed a teaching model for future sessions
4. April 29, 2021: We will discuss how data + common resources + custom tutorials = science users starting to migrate workflows to the cloud, and the LP DAAC will lead a teaching demo
